questions.questionText: What is an operating system?
options: A collection of programs that manages hardware resources
A device that connects computers to a network
A type of software used for document editing

questions.questionText: Which of the following is NOT a function of an operating system?
Which type of operating system is used in real-time applications?
What does CPU scheduling aim to achieve?
Which of the following is NOT an operating system?
Which scheduling algorithm gives each process an equal time slice?
Which memory management technique divides memory into fixed-sized blocks?
Which file system is used in modern Windows operating systems?
Which of the following is an example of a distributed operating system?
Which of these is NOT a type of system call?
Which component of the OS is responsible for process synchronization?
What is thrashing in operating systems?
options: Excessive swapping of processes between RAM and disk

questions.questionText: Which OS concept ensures that multiple processes can execute concurrently?
Which algorithm is used for deadlock avoidance?
What is a critical section in process synchronization?
options: A part of code that accesses shared resources
A memory section reserved for the OS
A special type of kernel module

questions.questionText: Which type of kernel allows modules to be loaded and unloaded at runtime?
What is a zombie process?
options: A child process that has terminated but not been waited on
A process with a memory leak
A process consuming all CPU time

questions.questionText: Which command is used in Linux to display running processes?
Which of these is a user-level thread library?
Which of the following best describes a microkernel?
options: Includes all services in kernel space
Runs most OS services in user space

questions.questionText: What does virtual memory allow?
options: Execution of large processes without real memory

questions.questionText: Which is the fastest scheduling algorithm?
Which of these is used to handle deadlock?

Which method is used to allocate resources in a deadlock-free manner?
What is the purpose of device drivers in OS?
options: To convert high-level code to machine code
To allow OS to communicate with hardware

questions.questionText: Which technique allows multiple programs to reside in memory at the same time?
Which mechanism is used to manage input/output operations?
Which of these is not part of the process control block (PCB)?
What is context switching?
options: Switching from user to kernel mode

questions.questionText: Which is NOT a benefit of multithreading?

Which one is NOT a file access method?
Which of the following is true for SJF scheduling?

What is spooling in OS?
options: A form of buffering for I/O devices

options: Translate user commands into system calls

It enables execution of processes not in main memory

questions.questionText: Which system software acts as an intermediary between user and hardware?

options: The number of processes per second
Time taken to complete all processes

questions.questionText: Which page replacement algorithm may suffer from Belady’s anomaly?
What is meant by starvation in operating systems?
options: A process not getting CPU time
